author: Shay Castle
title: Lost: Boulder Map Gallery closing as digital options erode paper map sales
text: Automakers remain silent as they walk a tightrope with Trump January 30, 2017, 4:56 pm Automakers are walking a tightrope as they court Trump, whose policies on clean-air standards, corporate taxes and trade will affect their fortunes. They have to balance that against other considerations closer to home: The traditional three U.S. automakers are based in Michigan, which backed Trumpâ€™s surprise victory but also has a substantial Middle Eastern population troubled by his executive order... Return Path buys Louisville e-mail data firm to securely smarten up message delivery January 30, 2017, 4:40 pm New York-based Return Path said Monday it would buy up everything Louisville-based ThreatWave had to offer, including about 10 people. Construction worker deaths are up, but overall workplace deaths are down in Colorado January 30, 2017, 4:46 pm In 2015, 75 Colorado workers died on the job, down from 84 workplace fatalities in 2014. Transportation-related deaths accounted for the most, at 34, including 22 workers killed on the road, while construction-related deaths rose sharply. Drops for postelection winners drag stocks lower January 30, 2017, 4:46 pm U.S. stocks fell Monday as investors grew nervous following President Donald Trump imposed a travel ban on seven Muslim-majority countries. Energy companies, which have surged over the last year, took the biggest losses.
